relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
They just give tickets all the time.
Get involved. This would be a great way to start!
Just join any club possible and you'll fit in
Lots of people that go to this campus live in the city.
Overall, good school. Just frustrating. Im going to get a masters just because I cant find a good job. Unfortunately.
Snowboarding. Sledding! It's not expensive. Get a job! That's the best part lol Go to the library and walmart
Food sucks. Same thing every week.
Lame. Boys and girls aren't around each other. It's like you are being babysat all the time in the freshmen dorms. I would suggest trying to live off campus once you find a good friend group.
Make sure you join as many organizations as possible. Get into student government Apply to be an RA
It is very cold. Not a lot of normal people. Groups are already made and it's hard to join friends
pageTitle: Lake Superior State University (LSSU) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {15260=sault ste. marie michigan hosts the i500 (large snowmobile race) every february and it brings the whole town together as well as many students from campus. the i500 has become a town tradition. the d1 hockey team also brings the whole town together on game nights to support them. it's a great family atmosphere when the town comes together., 4627=Try and spread out your Gen Ed's for the summer if you're planning on leasing off campus, that way you can take time on your major classes without feeling overwhemled with needed extras. Also, as of right now (2009 - 2010 school year), you'll pay a flat rate for credits. So whether you take 12 or 17 credits, you're paying the same amount. This would be the college to take that yoga class, or to learn to scuba dive. You'll enjoy it, and it'll be a stress reliever. Plus, you're already paying for it., 118653=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students If you're not afraid of a lot of snow at one time and like being outdoors this would be a great college. Tips for prospective students Come and tour the campus. I toured the campus a couple times before I decided to attend. It's small so you can find your classes easily and fast. The campus is in a city but there are a lot of wilderness to be discovered too. Am enjoying being here I love the upper peninsula. This is a small campus and I come from a small town so it isn't so overwhelming. Am learning a lot The student to professor ratio is really good so you get to do a lot of one on one with your professor. It's helping me learn the material and then some extra. Login to rate or flag the reviews Student in Sault Sainte Marie, MI 12/22/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 4 of 32
